Dating: 11TH DYNASTY (not before); 11TH DYNASTY ?; MIDDLE KINGDOM (not after)
Name: Figurine in beeswax
Description: This object modelled in beeswax  belongs to a category of figurines which represent men and woman standing, the arms alongside the body. Certain authors consider them as the precurser to shabtis which appeared from the beginning of the Middle Kingdom. This figurine of a woman, of which the provenace is not known with certainty (Gebelein?), probably dates from the 11th Dynasty.
